description: Distinct values of LCM { p(i)-1, i=1..n}, where p() are the primes.
comments: The prime A095365(n) is the least prime yielding an LCM of a(n). This sequence and A095365 are related to A095366. - _T. D. Noe_, Jun 04 2004
example: For p = 29, 31, 37, 41, 43 these LCMs are equal to 55440 = 11*7! = LCM[1, 2, 4, 6, 10, 12, 16, 22, 28, 30, 36, 40, 42] = LCM[1, 2, 4, 6, 10, 12, 16, 22, 28]. The values was put on the stage only once. Repetitions skipped.
crossrefs: Cf. A095366 (least k > 1 such that k divides 1^n + 2^n +...+ (k-1)^n).
author: _Labos Elemer_, Dec 06 2000
